reviews.text: From some of the reviews you would think that the hotel is in the middle of nowhere, so I was pleasantly surprised to find several restaurants, two supermarkets and a bakery (Panifico - Via dello Zenzero) that are all within a 5 minute walk. The main thing is that the hotel is just a couple of miles of some stunning beaches.
reviews.title: Stay at the hotel, dream at the beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Admittedly, without a hire car one does feel a bit limited. So any longer than 4 days without a car would be too long. The hotel hires out bikes for 15 euros each per day. Also, there's a free shuttle to the beach. The driver we had was very friendly and professional. The reception staff were helpful too - especially Federica who organised our airport shuttle.
reviews.title: Perfect for a quiet break
Enjoyable stay at Hotel Speraesole
reviews.text: Some of the reviews say that the rooms overlooking the road are not as good as those with a pool or garden view. In fact, the road view room that I had was very clean and quiet. It was also far away from the banqueting area, which was just as well because there was a wedding on one of the days of our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar / cafe has a good snack menu and cocktail list but many things are only available for a limited time during the day and early evening, if at all, which was a little disappointing. The breakfast buffet had plenty of choice and the coffee was excellent. If you have an early flight then you can order a packed breakfast to take away.
reviews.title: Nice hotel for a relaxing break.

reviews.text: Overall this hotel is a nice place to stay. It's not 5* but neither are the rates. It is, however, a clean hotel and the staff are helpful.
reviews.title: Good hotel for older people
